attributes.action: “We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to ‘call in’ plans by Livepool FC  to redevelop Stanley Park.”
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Details of Petition:

    “Whereas the above planning application by Liverpool Football Club to redevelop Stanley Park is in contravention of the Liverpool Council Unitary Development Plan; and whereas further unaddressed issues of scale, transport and public disorder are present; and whereas the development conflicts with national planning policy on important matters; and whereas the development will have wide effects beyond its immediate locality; and whereas the development raises significant architectural and urban design issues; and whereas the developement will severley reduce the access to open spaces for the Public; and whereas the development has evoked significant regional controversy; we, the undersigned, hereby petition the Prime Minister and his Secretary of State for Communities and Local Government (Mrs Blears) to exercise their powers under s.77 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 to examine the said proposal by way of a full public inquiry.”

rejection.details: We have been advised by the Department for Communities and Local Government that it is not possible to call in plans after they have been considered and subsequently granted planning permission. You should contact the appropriate local authority directly.
reasons: Outside the remit of the Prime Minister and Government
